Taliban vows revenge for 16 killed in Afghanistan

Even before a US soldier allegedly shot and killed 16 Afghan civilians yesterday, anti-Americanism was already boiling in Afghanistan. (AP, 2:09 p.m.)
  • Afghan civilians killed  |  Pictures Reaction  |  More

Passenger in D.J. Henry’s car said he assumed police wanted them to move

Authorities have said a Pleasantville, N.Y., police officer fired through the windshield of Henry’s car, killing him because Henry drove toward him. (Globe, 2:14 p.m.)
  • Documents, audio, and video in the Henry case

Mmmm: Boston's 25 best comfort foods

Eastern Standard’s butterscotch bread pudding is a custardy square surrounded by salted caramel sauce and topped with praline ice cream. Courtesy of Eastern Standard
Each bucket of biscuits from Boston’s Sweet Cheeks comes with four of the tallest, fluffiest biscuits around, served with honey butter. Aram Boghosian for The Boston Globe
At the Blue Ox in Lynn, chef-owner Matt O’Neil's clam chowder is rich and smoky with applewood bacon. Joanna O'Neil/The Blue Ox
During Sunday brunch, Craigie on Main in Cambridge serves a doughnut with caramel confiture du lait, or caramel milk jam. Craigie On Main
Buttermilk fried chicken from Highland Kitchen in Somerville is generously portioned with mashed potatoes and gravy, collards, and a biscuit. Wendy Maeda/ Globe staff
Ice cream sundaes at Cabot’s in Newtonville are served dripping over the edge of the dish, and come in your choice of more than 40 flavors and 35 toppings. Cabot's Ice Cream
  • Pictures 2012 New England Food Show
  • Video Phantom Gourmet's top comfort food picks
  • Greater Boston's best new restaurants of 2012

Zuniga named for Gaming Commission

Treasurer Steven Grossman named Enrique Zuniga, the executive director of the Mass. Water Pollution Abatement Trust, to sit on the board. (Globe, 12:32 p.m.)

Another warm-weather record could fall

Temperatures could hit 72 degrees in Boston today which would eclipse the previous record high of 69 degrees for this date set back in 1902. (Globe, 11:47 a.m.)

Both sides rest in Mattapan massacre trial, closing arguments set for Tuesday

The prosecution rested this morning after calling nearly 50 witnesses in the murder trial of four people. The defense only called three witnesses. (Globe, 11:44 a.m.)

DiMasi loses bid to stay in R.I. prison

Lifestyle

Black Monday

In Portsmouth, the first Monday in March has become known as Kate the Great Day, and it is the only day of the year that this particular beer is available. Hundreds of people wait in line for hours for it, praying it doesn’t run out.
